Articles.Content:
I want some missions for me to perform.

Story

The evil north is threatening in to invade. After negotiations failed we are prepping for war.

Just ask and i will add you as a kerbal. Just tell me what type of kerbal you want to be (commander or engineer) and i will add you.

Missions can be anything in the kerban system.

Edited August 18, 2013 by patmatt2

Organise a Mutually Assured Destruction scenario: both sides have so many strong weapons that they could annihilate the other side multiple times over. Neither side can initiate combat without risking total annihilation of both sides, therefor nobody will die :-)
That would kill the story so nope
If your after a mission, why not try to set up or shoot down a spy satellite?
....The devs have repeatedly said that this will not be a thing, ever. Go look at the suggestion forum.

....The devs have repeatedly said that this will not be a thing, ever. Go look at the suggestion forum.

He's not requesting for it to be available in the game, he's asking for suggestions on his save file that is roleplayed with his own missions. Try to read the thread before posting instead of just reading the title and replying blindly.
I'd love to see one side try and make some mun cannons (look to danny2462, return cannon if you want to see the sort of thing I mean)

Organise a Mutually Assured Destruction scenario: both sides have so many strong weapons that they could annihilate the other side multiple times over. Neither side can initiate combat without risking total annihilation of both sides, therefor nobody will die :-)

What's the point of trying to simulate real life? It's boring!!!

Are you going to use just stock or mods? I would suggest putting a battle station/carrier into space and crewing it up with carrier craft, tugs, so on. Make a fleet. And yes, weapons can be designed from stock. Look at the rocket exchange section. Some people are assembling ships up to 600 tons in orbit.

Mission 1: The KIA (Kerbal Intelligance Agency), has requested 24/7 survalence of the north so that we we have early warning should they try to invade. Your task is to provide said coverage. You may feel free to design whatever system meets out goals, but the network must be operational within 3 Kerban weeks.

Mission 2: EMERGENCY ACTION KESSAGE ...

authenticate Kilo, Echo, Romeo, Bravo, Alpha, Lima.

Eyes Only.

One of our operatives was discovered and nearly killed a week ago. This operative has vital information regarding our enemy. In his haste to escape he read his compass wrong and went further north instead of south.

You must design and build a craft capable of rescuing our operative from Kerbin's North Pole and returning him safely to the KSC Space Center.

Keep in mind our enemy has about the same capabilities we do in terms of radar and tracking. You will either need to design a craft that will fly above their coverage (100,000 m) and drop down into the North Pole, or you will need your craft to look like a peaceful polar research vehicle(s).

Our operative only has enough supplies to survive for 3 days. You must hurry!
I'm using mods like the gat cannon and pirated weapons and infernal robotics
Love the missions with be doing em
We think there may be a secret Northern base in the Great Desert. Send a spy satellite so that we can confirm.

Mission 3: Our agency's engineers have failed to come up with an adequate air defense plan for the KSC. We have some big plans for your facilities (more on that later).

Right now, your too vulnerable to air attack. Design, build, and deploy the following:

Minimum of 3 SAM (surface to air missle) sites, preferably 6 or more. Each should be able to engage targets in a 360 degree arc around the center.

Minimum of 6 AAA Sites, with 10 sites preferable.

PS: get our other missions done too!!!
Sure thing
I came up with these in like 5 min of thinking. Use your imagination!!!

What's the point of trying to simulate real life? It's boring!!!

then why try to get weapons, war, people killing each other in all sort of ways, snuck in through the backdoor when it's been repeated a million times that there will be no weapons in KSP?

Mission 4: Enemy is constructing an secret facility at the north pole. It is heavily defended against both air and land approach, as well as anti-satellite weapons. Your mission is to build a stealth spy plane capable of reaching the target, taking pictures of it without being detected and return to the KSC with the intel acquired. Due to enemy radar capabilities, the plane would have to be under 150 parts and capable of making the return trip as well.

Reading comprehension error detected. He's not requesting war to be added to the game--merely asking for ideas for military related missions to do for fun.

which is the same, in veiled form... And you'd realise I was responding to someone else directly, so the reading comprehension error is on your part.

Mission 4 : Now that you've added some security we have a rather large project for you. Don't worry about the funding, it's been handled.

We want you to setup a "peaceful research facility" on the dark side of the Mun. Our new facility should contain enough modules to support up to 10 Kerbals. Initially it will be deployed un-manned. We're told you can't control these things without being able to get a signal to them, so you've been allocated a small sum to place a communications satellite into orbit around the Mun as well, just make sure out new base is operational within the year.

How about this:

The enemy has an orbital battle station capable of firing guided missiles from orbit, you must build an SSTO capable of rondevouzing with tha battle station and destroying it before it comes within range of your surface base and destroys it. It has to be an SSTO because any larger conventional ship will leave too big a signature and will give them too much warning.

He's not requesting for it to be available in the game, he's asking for suggestions on his save file that is roleplayed with his own missions. Try to read the thread before posting instead of just reading the title and replying blindly.
